dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 3006 IH: Helping Save Americans’ Health Care Choices Act of 2015
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Fleming introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to improve health savings accounts, and for other purposes.

subsection.text: This Act may be cited as the Helping Save Americans’ Health Care Choices Act of 2015.
The table of sections for this Act is as follows:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 2. Elimination of requirement that coverage must be under a high deductible health plan.
Sec. 3. Increase the maximum contribution limit to an HSA.
Sec. 4. Allow both spouses to make catch-up contributions to the same HSA account.
Sec. 5. HSA funds may be used for health insurance premiums.
Sec. 6. Increased portability of health savings accounts.
Sec. 7. Certain physician fees to be treated as medical care.
Sec. 8. Special rule for certain medical expenses incurred before establishment of account.
Sec. 9. Medicare recipients made eligible for HSAs.
Sec. 10. FSA funds may be used for long-term care insurance premiums.
Sec. 11. Repeal of limitation on deductions making non-prescription drugs non-qualifying distributions from tax-preferred accounts.
Sec. 12. Repeal of additional tax from distributions from HSAs and MSAs.
Sec. 13. Repeal of limitation on health flexible spending arrangements under cafeteria plans.

section.header: Elimination of requirement that coverage must be under a high deductible health plan

subsection.text: Section 223(c) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking paragraphs (1) and (2) and inserting the following new paragraphs:

paragraph.text: The term eligible individual means, with respect to any month, any individual if such individual is covered under a eligible health plan as of the 1st day of such month.

The term eligible health plan means any health plan (including membership in a health care sharing ministry as defined in section 5000A(d)(2)(B)) other than coverage consisting solely of excepted benefits as defined in section 9832(c).
The following sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are each amended by striking high deductible health plan each place it appears, as the case may be, and inserting eligible health plan:
With respect to the amendments made by this section, the matter being inserted shall bear the same case, number, font, and font size as the matter being replaced.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Increase the maximum contribution limit to an HSA

subsection.text: Section 223(b)(2)(A) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking $2,250 and inserting $6,450.
Section 223(b)(2)(B) of such Code is amended by striking $4,500 and inserting $12,900.
Section 223(g)(1) of such Code is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subsections (b)(2) and (c)(2)(A) and inserting subsection (b)(2), and
by amending subparagraph (B) thereof to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: the cost-of-living adjustment determined under section 1(f)(3) for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins determined by substituting calendar year 2014 for calendar year 1992 in subparagraph (B) thereof.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Allow both spouses to make catch-up contributions to the same HSA account

subsection.text: Section 223(b)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.header: Special rule where both spouses are eligible individuals with 1 account

clause.text: an individual and the individual’s spouse have both attained age 55 before the close of the taxable year, and
the spouse is not an account beneficiary of a health savings account as of the close of such year,

subparagraph.continuation-text: the additional contribution amount shall be 200 percent of the amount otherwise determined under subparagraph (B).

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: HSA funds may be used for health insurance premiums

subsection.text: Section 223(d)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking subparagraphs (B) and (C).
The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Increased portability of health savings accounts

subsection.header: Treatment after death of account beneficiary
subsection.text: Section 223(f)(8)(A) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.header: Treatment if designated beneficiary is family member
subparagraph.text: If a surviving spouse or lineal descendant of the spouse or the account beneficiary acquires the account beneficiary’s interest in a health savings account by reason of being the designated beneficiary of such account at the death of the account beneficiary, such health savings account shall be treated as if the designated beneficiary were the account beneficiary.

subsection.text: So much of subparagraph (A) of section 223(d)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 as precedes Such term is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: The term qualified medical expenses means amounts paid for medical care (as defined in section 213(d)), but only to the extent such amounts are not compensated for by insurance or otherwise.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Certain physician fees to be treated as medical care

subsection.text: Section 213(d) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by redesignating paragraph (4) as paragraph (5) and by inserting after paragraph (3) the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: The term medical care shall include amounts paid by patients to their primary physician in advance for the right to receive medical services on an as-needed basis.

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Special rule for certain medical expenses incurred before establishment of account

subsection.text: Section 223(d) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended by the preceding provisions of this Act, is amended by redesignating paragraph (5) as paragraph (6) and by inserting after paragraph (4) the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Treatment of account established before tax return due for tax year
paragraph.text: For purposes of this section, if, before the time prescribed by law for filing the return of tax for a taxable year (not including extensions thereof), a taxpayer—

subparagraph.text: makes contributions to a health savings account on account of such taxable year, or
makes payments or distributions from a health savings account for such taxable year,

paragraph.continuation-text: the health savings account shall be deemed to be established on the last day of such taxable year and such contributions and distributions shall be deemed to have been made on account of such taxable year if the taxpayer elects the application of this paragraph for such taxable year.

subsection.text: Section 223(d)(6) of such Code, as redesignated by subsection (a), is amended by striking subparagraph (B) and redesignating subparagraphs (C) through (E) as subparagraphs (B) through (D), respectively.

The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to health savings accounts established, and contributions to and distributions from health savings accounts after, the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Medicare recipients made eligible for HSAs

subsection.header: Medicare recipients may contribute to HSAs
subsection.text: Section 223(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking paragraph (7).

subsection.header: Medicare beneficiaries participating in medicare advantage MSA may contribute their own money to their MSA
subsection.text: Section 138(b) of such Code is amended by striking paragraph (2) and by redesignating paragraphs (3) and (4) as paragraphs (2) and (3), respectively.
The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: FSA funds may be used for long-term care insurance premiums

subsection.text: Subsection (c) of section 106 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by redesignating paragraph (2) as paragraph (3) and by amending so much of such subsection as precedes such paragraph (3) to read as follows:

subsection.header: Long-Term care benefits provided through flexible spending arrangements

paragraph.text: Gross income of an employee shall not include employer-provided coverage for qualified long-term care services (as defined in section 7702B(c)) to the extent that such coverage is provided through a flexible spending or similar arrangement.
Qualified medical expenses for which reimbursement may be made by distributions from a flexible spending arrangement shall include amounts paid for long-term care coverage.

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Repeal of limitation on deductions making non-prescription drugs non-qualifying distributions from tax-preferred accounts

subsection.text: Section 223(d)(2)(A) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking the last sentence.
Section 220(d)(2)(A) of such Code is amended by striking the last sentence.

subsection.header: Health flexible spending arrangements and health reimbursement arrangements
subsection.text: Section 106 of such Code is amended by striking subsection (f).

paragraph.text: The amendments made by subsections (a) and (b) shall apply to amounts paid with respect to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.
The amendment made by subsection (c) shall apply to expenses incurred with respect to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Repeal of additional tax from distributions from HSAs and MSAs

subsection.text: Section 223(f)(4)(A) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking 20 percent and inserting 10 percent.
Section 220(f)(4)(A) of such Code is amended by striking 20 percent and inserting 15 percent.
The amendments made by this section shall apply to distributions made after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Repeal of limitation on health flexible spending arrangements under cafeteria plans

subsection.text: Section 125 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating subsections (j), (k), and (l) as subsections (i), (j), and (k), respectively.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.
